subject: Languages
title: The Great Vowel Shift
description: A fast breakdown of The Great Vowel Shift for builders.

hook.text: Between 1400 and 1700, English pronunciation changed so much that Chaucer became unreadable.

buildup.text: Every long vowel in English shifted upward in the mouth over three centuries.

discovery.text: The word 'name' once rhymed with 'comma.' 'Meet' sounded like 'mate.'

twist.text: Nobody knows why it happened. Wars, plagues, and migration may have jumbled dialects.

climax.text: Spelling was already fixed by the printing press â€” so sounds moved but letters stayed.

punchline.text: English spelling is chaos because the sounds changed but the letters didn't.

quiz.question: Why is English spelling so irregular?
options: Pronunciation shifted after spelling was fixed
